alert.note: Alert for Kootenai, Cabinet Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 11 at 1:33PM MST until January 12 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, extreme cold expected. Wind chills as low as 60 below zero. Periods of poor visibility and blowing snow with flash freezing on roadways will make travel dangerous this evening. * WHERE...Highway 37 Eureka to Libby, Highway 56 Bull Lake Road, Highway 93 Eureka to Whitefish, and Highway 2 Kalispell to Libby. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 5 AM MST Friday. For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
